repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Pamphlets and other documents re Brookwood Labor College available in this substantial collection. Unpublished guide Available.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: ALES Records #5225. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5225 C: ALES Course Materials 5225 E: ALES Labor Education Records 5225 I: ALES International Labor Records 5225 L: ALES Labor Plays 5225 S: ALES Scrapbooks 5657: American Labor Education Service Additional Documents

did.unittitle: Correspondence arid cooperation with labor organizations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: including local unions, state and regional bosies, international unions, departments of the AFL-CIO and organizations related to labor and workers' education. Filed with correspondence are conference programs and speeches and pamphlets. ALES was the only U.S. member of the International Federation of Workers Education Association. The following are represented: AFL-CIO, Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, International Union of Electrical Workers, International Federation of Workers' Education Association, International Confederation of Free Trade Unions, ILGWU, International Labour Office, Industrial and Labor Relations Review, Jewish Labor Committee, Kentucky State Federation of labor, Labor and Nation, Labor Education Association of Philadelphia, International Association of Machinists, Massachusetts CIO Council, Meat Cutters and Butcher Workmen, Michigan CIO Council, Minnesota CIO Council, Montana State Federation of Labor, National Farmers Union, National Institute of Labor Education, New York City Central Labor Council, Ohio CIO Council, Oil Chemical and Atomic Weapons Workers International Union, National Alliance of Postal Workers, Religion and Labor Foundation, American State County and Municipal Employees, American Federation of Teachers, Local 189, Textile Workers Union of America, United Automobile Workers, Workers Defense League

did.unittitle: Correspondence arid cooperation with labor organizations

scopecontent.p: including local unions, state and regional bosies, international unions, departments of the AFL-CIO and organizations related to labor and workers' education. Filed with correspondence are conference programs and speeches and pamphlets. ALES was the only U.S. member of the International Federation of Workers Education Association.
